text: Choose the correct form of the verb: She ___ to the park every Sunday. (Medium)
explanation: The sentence is in the present simple tense, used for habits. The correct form for 'she' is 'goes'.

text: What is the synonym of 'happy'? (Medium)
explanation: 'Joyful' is a synonym for 'happy', meaning feeling or showing pleasure.

text: Complete the sentence: If I ___ harder, I would have passed the exam. (Hard)
explanation: This is a third conditional sentence for an unreal past situation. The correct form is 'had studied'.

text: Choose the correct preposition: She is good ___ playing the piano. (Medium)
explanation: The preposition 'at' is used with 'good' when referring to skills or activities.

text: Which sentence is grammatically correct? (Medium)
explanation: 'She doesn’t like coffee' is correct in present simple negative form for third person singular.

text: What is the meaning of 'exhausted'? (Medium)
explanation: 'Exhausted' means very tired or having used up all energy.

text: Choose the correct form: By the time we arrive, they ___ dinner. (Hard)
explanation: Future perfect tense is used for an action completed before a future point. Correct form: 'will have finished'.

text: Which word is an antonym of 'big'? (Medium)
explanation: 'Small' is the opposite of 'big' in terms of size.

text: Correct the sentence: He go to school yesterday. (Medium)
explanation: Past simple tense requires 'went' for the verb 'go' with 'he'. Correct: He went to school yesterday.

text: Choose the correct article: ___ apple is on the table. (Medium)
explanation: 'An' is used before a vowel sound like 'apple'.

text: What is the passive form of 'They are painting the house'? (Hard)
explanation: In the present continuous passive, the object becomes the subject: 'The house is being painted.'

text: Choose the correct word: I have ___ friends in London. (Medium)
explanation: 'A few' is used for a small number of countable nouns like 'friends'.

text: Which sentence uses the correct conditional? (Hard)
explanation: Second conditional for unreal present situations: 'If I were rich, I would travel the world.'

options.label: A
options.text: If I am rich, I travel the world.

options.label: B
options.text: If I were rich, I would travel the world.

options.label: C
options.text: If I was rich, I will travel the world.

options.label: D
options.text: If I be rich, I would travel the world.

text: What does 'postpone' mean? (Medium)
explanation: 'Postpone' means to delay or put off to a later time.

text: Choose the correct tense: She ___ in Paris for two years before she moved. (Hard)
explanation: Past perfect continuous is used for an action that continued until a point in the past: 'had been living'.

text: Which word fits best? The movie was so ___ that I cried. (Medium)
explanation: 'Touching' means emotionally moving, fitting the context of crying during a movie.

text: Choose the correct reported speech: She said, 'I will call you.' (Hard)
explanation: In reported speech, 'will' changes to 'would': She said that she would call me.

options.label: A
options.text: She said that she will call me.

options.label: B
options.text: She said that she would call me.

options.label: C
options.text: She said that she calls me.

options.label: D
options.text: She said that she is calling me.

text: What is the plural form of 'child'? (Medium)
explanation: The plural of 'child' is 'children', an irregular plural form.

text: Choose the correct word: I need ___ information about the course. (Medium)
explanation: 'Some' is used for uncountable nouns like 'information' in positive sentences.

text: Which sentence is in the correct passive voice? (Hard)
explanation: Passive voice for present perfect: 'The book has been read by many students.'

options.label: A
options.text: The book is read by many students.

options.label: B
options.text: The book has been read by many students.

options.label: C
options.text: The book was reading by many students.

options.label: D
options.text: The book reads by many students.

text: What does 'anxious' mean in this context: She was anxious about the test. (Medium)
explanation: In this context, 'anxious' means nervous or worried.

text: Choose the correct modal verb: You ___ finish your homework before playing. (Medium)
explanation: 'Must' indicates obligation or necessity in this context.

text: Which sentence uses the correct relative pronoun? (Hard)
explanation: 'Who' is used for people as the subject of the relative clause: 'The man who lives next door is kind.'

options.label: A
options.text: The man which lives next door is kind.

options.label: B
options.text: The man who lives next door is kind.

options.label: C
options.text: The man that he lives next door is kind.

options.label: D
options.text: The man whose lives next door is kind.

text: What is the meaning of 'purchase'? (Medium)
explanation: 'Purchase' means to buy something.

text: Choose the correct form: I wish I ___ taller. (Hard)
explanation: 'Wish' with present unreal situations uses the past subjunctive: 'were'.

text: Which word completes the sentence: The weather is ___ cold today. (Medium)
explanation: 'Quite' means fairly or somewhat, fitting the context of describing the weather.

text: Choose the correct reported question: He asked, 'Where are you going?' (Hard)
explanation: Reported questions change word order and tense: 'He asked where I was going.'

options.label: A
options.text: He asked where are you going.

options.label: B
options.text: He asked where I was going.

options.label: C
options.text: He asked where you were going.

options.label: D
options.text: He asked where am I going.

text: What is the comparative form of 'good'? (Medium)
explanation: The comparative form of 'good' is 'better'.

text: Choose the correct phrasal verb: She ___ her old clothes to charity. (Medium)
explanation: 'Gave away' means to donate or give something for free.

text: Which sentence uses the correct gerund? (Hard)
explanation: Gerunds are used as nouns after certain verbs like 'enjoy': 'I enjoy swimming.'
